citation.article-title: Paenibacillus siamensis sp. nov., Paenibacillus septentrionalis sp. nov. and Paenibacillus montaniterrae sp. nov., xylanase-producing bacteria from Thai soils.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus montaniterrae sp. nov.
Paenibacillus montaniterrae (mon.ta′ni.ter′rae. L. adj. montanus of a mountain, L. n. terra soil; N.L. gen. n. montaniterrae of mountain soil, where the type strain was isolated).
Central or subterminal ellipsoidal endospores are observed in swollen sporangia.
Grows in 3 and 5 % NaCl, at pH 7–9 and at 15–50 °C and under anaerobic conditions; does not grow at pH 5–6, 10 °C or 55–60 °C.

Positive for the Voges–Proskauer reaction, urease and hydrolysis of aesculin, starch and Tween 80; negative for catalase, oxidase, the methyl red test, DNase, indole production, growth on Simmons' citrate and TSI agar, nitrate reduction, dihydroxyacetone production and hydrolysis of l-arginine, casein, gelatin and l-tyrosine.

Acid production from amygdalin, aesculin, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, glycogen, gentiobiose, inulin, d-lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melibiose, methyl β-xyloside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin, starch, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and d-xylose.

No acid production from N-acetylglucosamine, d-adonitol, arbutin, d-arabinose, d- or l-arabitol, erythritol, dulcitol, d- or l-fucose, gluconate, 2- or 5-ketogluconate, inositol, melezitose, methyl α-d-mannoside, d-lyxose, methyl α-d-glucoside, d- or l-sorbitol, l-xylose, xylitol or d-tagatose.
The cell-wall diamino acid is meso-DAP.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 48.8 mol%.
The predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 0.
